author: Staff Reporter
text:
In a swift operation, Theni forest officials arrested one more suspected elephant poacher here on Tuesday. The arrested was Vana Raj (53) of Aranmanaipudur on Varushanadu hill.

He was produced before Uthamapalayam Judicial Magistrate Court and remanded in 15 days’ judicial custody. Vana Raj was one of the accomplices of Mani of Varushanadu, a habitual poacher who was reportedly involved in elephant poaching and ivory smuggling in Kerala and Tamil Nadu.

Tip-off

Acting on a tip-off, a special team intensified search operations and nabbed him on Varushanadu hill, said forest officials.

Forest Department sources said that the accused, along with Mani, had been engaged in poaching activities in the forests spreading from Ooty to Idukki district in Kerala, including Theni.

A special team had nabbed Mani of Varushandu and his accomplice Ganesan of Chennai on March 13 from a hideout in Tirupur and brought them to Theni district for interrogation.

Other gang members – Kubendran and Sendrayan – had also been arrested. Both Kerala and Tamil Nadu forest officials were on the lookout for them for the past two years.

An elephant poaching and ivory smuggling case was also pending against them in Kerala since 2014.
title: Another poacher held in Theni
